DialogueLine.dialogue: Hey, it's one of my favorite curators! Don't tell miss Cassandra, hoho!
Lovely morning, isn't it?
What?
Good morning.
Good morning, Ma'am. I fixed up your cubicle while you were out on vacation.
Hello Ma'am. Isn't it quite a lovely day?
I need a coffee.
Is there something you need? I ain't got all day.
Oh... How can I help?
What'dya need?
Ah... um... I can't help you with that. Director Virgil will get mad at me... haha.
I can't help you with that, I'm afraid. I'll need the director's permission first.
No can do, ma'am. That's going to get me in trouble.
Hmph. Can't help you with that.
Can't help you. Now scram, I'm busy.
Sorry, can't really help with that.
No.
Hmm. I don't know. Might have to ask others for that.
No clue. Try asking the assistant over there.
Oh, I'm sorry. I don't know the answer to that.
You'll have to ask the assistant for that, dear. I haven't seen the director today.
Oh man... I don't know. You could ask the people upstairs, maybe the director went to his office while I'm busy.
I'm sorry, I don't know where he is. Try asking Annie over there.
That's terrible! Though I'm not sure where it went...
I have no clue where it could have gone.
Well I haven't gone there since last afternoon...
Is there something you're implying? I don't appreciate how accusatory you are right now.
If you're asking if I had something to do with your artifact, no I don't. Please leave.
Alright.
Fine. I doubt I'll be of much help though.
Okay. I'll let you know.
Sure, I'll make sure to tell you anything new.
Th-that's a lot of pressure... but okay...
Um! Don't cry... you're going to have to figure out what to do... Have you asked the assistant for help?
You did? That's good news.
Gee, way to be appreciative of my help.
And what did you learn?
Is there anything you learned?
Oh, I'll have to look at it to know.
Where is it? You know I have to look at it to recognize it, right?
Uh... c-can I see? I can't remember stuff without seeing it... sorry...
Ah, sorry, I don't recognize this key. It could be one of the staff... Sorry I can't help!
Now that's more like it. When I look at it... I don't really recognize it. It's certainly not mine. Ask the others.
Ah... it's not mine. Sorry, I can't help you. But it's possible that it's a copy of one of the other staff.
Oh, this isn't anyone I know of. Perhaps someone in the building has a copy though, and they dropped it.
It was pretty good.
Good.
A-aahhhh... It's not great. I shouldn't tell you.
Not good. I'd tell you, if we weren't at work now.
Bad.
I went fishing.
I just went fishing. It's uneventful so I reckon you won't want to hear about it.
I was... knitting. Don't tell anyone else.
I just sat by the fire and did some knitting. That was the only enjoyable thing I did over the weekend.
It's... relaxing, I guess.
I baked a cake over the weekend.
I wrote my novel by the beach.
Did some baking.
Yes! I love baking for my loved ones.
... yes. I do it for my family.
That's none of your business. Bother someone else.
For the most part, I fish near the port. It's the closest, and most convenient.
Oh... um... You'll have to pay me for the work! Haha!
Absolutely not.
That better be a joke. I don't work for free.
Uhm! Hahaha. L-let's talk about that later.
No, because then I have a lot more things to do instead of just buy. But... if it makes my daughter happy, then I'm okay with all the work.
I have sisters... that's about the most interesting thing I could say there.
Oh... I have a daughter.
Well...I mostly just knit when there's not much to do while I'm at work. Then I continue knitting when I get home, after she falls asleep.
I bake during the weekends. It's not a weeklong-affair so I can whip something up by the time her birthday rolls around
I have a daughter. I took up knitting just so I can give her a lot of gifts.
Yes and no. He just talks a lot about his daughter when it's coming. That's how I know to help him out so he can have more free time. I try to help him out.
I actually ask the director for a slightly shorter workday, enough so that I have time to bake before the end of the day when she comes back from her part-time job.
Probably around the first week of October.
The name doesn't ring a bell. Let me see... yep, I don't recognize the handwriting either.
Oh, I'm not quite sure who this card is from. The handwriting isn't from someone in the staff either.
It's not from staff, which is a relief. Imagine the scandal if the director is with one of his employees!
Wh-what do you take me for? I'm not a gossip! I don't think that's relevant to the plinth, anyway.
Not interested. If it's relevant to your plinth, then say so.
I see... If it's not relevant to the plinth, I can't really comment on what you found.
This woman always brings along some gifts. Like a snacks basket. I appreciate her dropping by so often just for that.
*sniff* All I can say is she brings along some tasty gifts.
She always brings gifts. I don't partake in them, though.
Yes, that's always a good idea. I'll be here if you have any questions.
Good. I'm tired of the drama.
O-okay. I'll help whenever I can.
Great. Let me know if you need help.
I suppose that could be true. Why else would she always drop by?
I know that she had a lot of tension with the director recently, especially when the Aurora artifacts arrived.
She's been having a ton of issues with the director when the Aurora artifacts were shipped in. Who knows why, there's only so much I could hear when they talk about it.
I'm not completely sure why. But I have heard a few arguments from behind closed doors and Cassandra always seems mad at the director for reasons I'm uncertain of.
What I do know is that she threatened to quit. Multiple times, in fact. I keep overhearing them argue.
She threatened to quit. That's the part I'm sure of. Why, I'm not sure.
She did? That's surprising. I know she loves working here. I can't imagine what would make her quit.
What? How could she do that? She loves it here. I've never considered that she would want to leave, so I have no idea WHY she'd want to leave.
That sounds doubtful. She always says she loves this place. If she wanted to leave, I'd have no idea why.
I've already told you--their relationship is pretty rocky recently. She threatened to quit over something.
Their relationship is pretty rocky recently. She threatened to quit over something.
I've not seen her injury until today. {id:NPCInteraction_Floor2_custodian_0} talked to her last night, though.
She wasn't injured when I talked to her. She asked me to not touch any of the mess in the employee lounge as she's in the middle of researching the Aurora.
I did talk to her last night. She was requesting me not to clean up the employee lounge. Have you seen it? It's a bit messy. She said she was researching. I didn't see any wounds on her, though.
Sure, I'll fix it right up.
That's what I thought, too! But something must have been bothering her to threaten that.
I had the same thoughts. Something probably bothered her enough to want to quit.
I thought similarly... but she must have had her reasons. Otherwise, why would she leave a job she loves?
Come to think of it, yes I did! He was bringing inside a well-protected item into the storage. There was some cloth wrapped around it. That's all I know.
I did. I assumed it was just some new artifact so I didn't question it.
Looks real interesting.
Woah, isn't that a pretty thing!
Should you be holding that with your bare hands?
Sorry, I ain't that interested.
Really? Please show me, if you can.
I see... is that all?
Alright, now scram.
You must be busy. I'll leave you to it then.
Let me know if you need anything else!
I know. I saw him carry something into the storage room, after all.
Yes, I did saw him bring something into the storage room. I suppose this is it.
I reckon the director paid a pretty penny for that.
Right. Right. That all?
The director did a fantastic job tracking this down.
That must be why the director was busy.
I do, but I'd rather not talk about them.
Not since my ma and pa died. But I don't wanna talk about that. It's not important.
Yes, but it's non of yer business. Besides, I'm not close with the most of them.
Yes, though other than my ma and da, I'm not close with anyone else.
Since my mother and father died, my sisters are all I got.
Whatd'ya think I am, an encyclopedia? I ain't got any tips.
I don't have any tips, really.
If you're new, I'd suggest following the recipe, I guess. Baking is an exact science.
Sorry, I don't have any tips.
Well, there's not much I can give you as a tip. It's just my hobby, after all.
You should probably check that out.
Hey there. Anything new?
Got something more to say?
Did you find out anything else?
I really, really can't help you. I swear
I suppose that makes sense. The woman that visits seems close with the director.
That makes a lot of sense. They look pretty close.
I see... that explains how often the visitor looks for the director.
Yes... I plan to give her a stuffed toy...
Yes... I plan to bake her a cake...
Yes... but what I plan to do is a secret...
Yeah, I got that. Can't help you, though. I don't know where the boss has gone.
Right, but I'm not sure where Director Virgil went today. Last I saw him was yesterday.
I know, I'm sorry. You'll have to ask someone else, as I don't know anything right now.
Damn, miss Cass'll blow her fuse if she finds out. That plinth seemed important to her.
Really? I hope you're not panicking too much, I'll help out when I can.
I'll be sure to keep an eye out.
Absolutely not. Scram, I got work to do.
Of course not! Do you think I don't value this museum's security?
No way. I'm sorry, Enid, you're great, but I can't do that for you.
No can do, Enid.
Hmmm... sure thing. The passcode to my locker out back is my daughter's birthday. First week of October.
I can't, sorry. You'll figure it out.
Oh, assistant Annie didn't give the keys to me. You'll have to ask someone else.
